intro: Bambusa beisitiku var. hirsutissima, commonly known as the hairy bamboo, is a variant of the Bambusa beisitiku species native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its dense, hairy covering on the stems and leaves, which gives it a distinctive appearance. The plant is a tall, clumping bamboo that can reach heights of up to 10 meters. Its foliage is dark green and glossy, with narrow, lance-shaped leaves. This variety is often cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its unique texture and aesthetic appeal.
